CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week....  John Wesley AMEZ Church...on Herron Ave., Hill District, with six taverns located in same block."
TitMainTitle: Herron Avenue with John Wesley AME Zion Church, Herron Hill 5 & 10, and Speck's Market with sign on side reading "Vote Straight Democratic City Controller Pittsburgh Edward R. Frey, Member of Council for Pittsburgh Charles F. Dinan, John F. [...]ounahan, Paul. F. Jones, Emanuel F. Schifano," Hill District
